titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Roy Hill Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Kirsten Jensen

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 11:01

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist largely of motion picture film used in the production of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid and Slaughterhouse-Five. Additional materials include the production files, action photographs, and story boards from Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, as well as interviews and other documentation used for the documentary The Making of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from Media Design Studio, Yale University, 1980 and 1982, and from Universal Studios in 1986, 1987, and 1989. Additional material added in 2003.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for The Making of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid has been transferred to Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Three oversize mounted photographic prints of still images from the film Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid were removed from the collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George Roy Hill Papers (MS 1765). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in three series and one addition: I. Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid Production Files, Circa 1968-1971. Series II. Slaughterhouse-Five Files, Circa 1972. Series III. The World According to Garp Files, Circa 1981-1982.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: George Roy Hill was born in Minneapolis, Minnesota, in 1922 to George R. and Helen Frances Hill. After receiving his B.A. degree in music from Yale University in 1943, he served two years in the Marine Corps as a transport plane pilot. In 1949, Hill received a B.Litt. in literature and music from Trinity College, Dublin, and made his acting debut with Cyril Cusack at the Abbey Theatre in London. Hill's first teleplay, My Brother's Keeper, was presented in 1953 on the Kraft Television Theater. In 1956, Hill produced, directed, and co-authored A Night to Remember, for which he received two Emmy award nominations (for directing and writing); during the next six years, Hill continued to produce and direct presentations for television. Hill's directorial debut was the 1962 adaptation of Tennessee Williams's Period of Adjustment. Between 1962-1988, Hill directed thirteen additional films including Hawaii (1966), Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969), Slaughterhouse-Five (1972), and The Sting(1973), for which he was awarded the Oscar for best director.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist largely of motion picture film used in the production of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid and Slaughterhouse-Five. Additional materials include the production files, action photographs, and story boards from Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, as well as interviews and other documentation used for the documentary The Making of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid.

did.unittitle: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid series consists of two subseries of production files related to the creation of the movie Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid and of film footage and interviews used in the production of the documentary film, Making of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid. The bulk of the material are film reels, correspondence, working and final scripts, material on prospective actors, film stills, and storyboards-both photographic and "cut-to" drawings.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Order Reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives website.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid series is organized alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid movie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid subseries contains material that relates directly to the production of the feature film Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid such as photographs, costume designs, set design and blueprints, models, and storyboards, as well as correspondence with George Roy Hill, William Goldman, and various Hollywood executives.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Order Reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives website.

did.unittitle: The Making of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid documentary

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The The Making of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid subseries contains primarily films from the making of the documentary The Making of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid. The dates of the bulk of the material are estimated to be 1968.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Order Reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives website.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised almost entirely of film footage and sound from the original production of Slaughterhouse-Five, as well as interviews of actors, George Roy Hill, and other production crew members that were used in the creation of a documentary about the making of the movie. The documentary was never released due to incomplete copyright clearances. However, the final workprints as well as several "teaser" trailers are included in the files. The remainder of the series is comprised of sketches of scenes by Gene Johnson, and a small group of black and white photographs from the making of the film.

did.unittitle: The World According to Garp Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains material used in the production of the motion picture film, The World According to Garp (1982). Included are photographs, architectural drawings, and set designs.

did.unittitle: Photographs, architectural drawings, and set designs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession contains film reels and documents relating to the films Slaughterhouse-Five (1972) and The Effect of Gamma Rays on Man-in-the-Moon Marigolds (1972). Unless otherwise indicated in the inventory below, collection materials are undated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprises approximately thirty-five reels of motion picture film in various sizes housed in ten boxes, some wound on cores and some not.
